This is really cool. A gaggle of rocks was on the left side of screen, a wide stripe of scissors in the middle and a few papers on the right side. The scissors slew all of the papers, so there was nothing protecting the scissors from the stones and they were all massacred.

>>3491795
It's trying to do 100*99 collision checks up to 30 times per second. That's every single object on the stage doing hitTest() on every other clip on the stage regardless of how near or far they are, no binning or other non-trivial optimizations.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>3491824
I added early outs for collision detection, but it only made the CPU use worse. Even in the native player, CPU use almost doubled. Perhaps it's the String comparison. Maybe using Ints would be a lot faster.

>>3491738

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>3491749
>Ruffle
This is an AS3 game, Ruffle only knows how to advance frames, but not run AS3 code.
>Flash
Yeah, there's a local check for some reason, I don't know why the hell they do that.
Either open the swf directly from 4chan (press ctrl-O in the projector or File > Open, paste in https://i.4cdn.org/f/Arachnophilium.swf, wait through the nonexistent mochi ad) or drag the swf into 7-zip, extract the uncompressed swf, open it in a hex editor and turn the 26 (pushtrue) at offset 0x4179e into a 27 (pushfalse).

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>3491753
I could not get it to work with the ctrl-O method. I pasted it into the address and the file location.

I apologize for my noobishness, but I have never used a hex editor. I did extract it with 7-zip. I am not sure if I did it correctly. I found 0x004179E0 I don't know if that is the same 0x4179e. If found this:
19 CB A5 F2 FC 47 28 46 84 AB 4C 9B FD 55 29 E7
The Hex Editor I used was "https://hexed.it/".

How do you get it to work on your machine?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>3491768
Yeah, the right offset is 0x4179e, not 4179e0. You might've been looking at the stuff on the left side - in this case, it'll be on the "line" 41790, and "e" means it's the e-th (15th) byte on that "line".
In hexed.it, there's a "Go To" panel at the right side, you can paste that position in there to go directly to it.

Another way to find the right spot is to look for these bytes:
5e c2 1f 26 68 c2 1f
That 26 in the middle is the right place.

I don't know how opening the swf's online address in the projector didn't work, however. Network issues? Copied the comma? Can't assume anything.

For anyone else following this, I found that position by opening the file in ffdec, going to the script arachnophilia_fla.MainTimeline (after some time figuring out where it checks whether it's being played offline), clicking the true after "gBlockLocalhost = true", setting the P-Code source viewer to hex with instructions, then searching the stuff around it in a hex editor.

>>3491746
>I'm scared of the future driven by AI and algorithms where the AI would just give us suggestions to improve ourselves, measure our health and behavior through phones and watches and when it becomes autonomous and starts deciding for us,
That is the present. Though not wholly deciding for us, algorithms give suggestions, affect the top result of search engines, product listing order and other currently minute stuff like that. This has a cumulative influence but it's goal is more or less wholly capitalistic -- just attempting to get the most money for the owners by getting you to buy something or stay longer. Hell, remember that article from Safeway where some father found out his daughter was pregnant just based on her shopping habits (that were recorded in a membership account).
